meanings.definition: A long narrow lane where ropes are made.
meanings.sent1: The workers at the ropewalk were busy twisting fibers together.
meanings.sent2: I took a tour of the historic ropewalk to see how ropes were crafted in the past.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the ropewalk was a giant scratching post, much to the workers' amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a ropewalk of thoughts, each one intertwining with the next.
meanings.sent5: The ropewalk smelled of fresh hemp and echoed with the sounds of spinning machinery.

meanings.sent1: After dinner, we decided to ropewalk along the beach to enjoy the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The elderly couple would often ropewalk in the park, hand in hand.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to ropewalk across the fence, balancing effortlessly on the thin beam.
meanings.sent4: As the music played, she ropewalked across the dance floor with grace and poise.
meanings.sent5: The children ropewalked through the meadow, picking wildflowers along the way.
